item.title: Rebecca add a quote by William Makepeace Thackeray
item.description: "Which of us is happy in this world? Which of us has his desire? or, having it, is satisfied?" -- William Makepeace Thackeray

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "I like not only to be loved, but also to be told that I am loved. I am not sure that you are of the same mind. But the realm of silence is large enough beyond the grave. This is the world of light and speech, and I shall take leave to tell you that you are very dear." -- George Eliot

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it" -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "Tis very strange men should be so fond of being wickeder than they are." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A woman, especially if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nothing ever fatigues me, but doing what I do not like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain
